request.description:
Logs in the specified user, creating a new session in the process.

* If successful, adds the Session token to the Postman environment, which will be used by subsequent Ehrscape calls

A successful call will create a new OpenEHR session for the specified user. The session ID will be returned both as a JSON response to this call, as well as in the Ehr-Session HTTP response header.

In order to ensure that this newly created session is used on subsequent REST requests, the client needs to make the calls with the HTTP request header Ehr-Session value set to the session ID.

Example of a successful call response:

```{
  "action": "CREATE",
  "sessionId": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}
The response header, with the Ehr-Session set, will look like this:

{
  "Server": "Jetty(9.1.1.v20140108)",
  "Transfer-Encoding": "chunked",
  "Content-Language": "en-US",
  "Content-Type": "application/json;charset=UTF-8",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Origin": "http://localhost:8082",
  "Access-Control-Expose-Headers": "",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Credentials": "true",
  "Ehr-Session": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}```
Refreshes the timeout on an open session

request.description: This method deletes a party denoted by its id from the remote demographics store, along with all its sub-entities (such as additional info).

body.raw:
{
  "aql": "select
 e/ehr_id/value as ehrId,
 e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/id/value as subjectId,
 e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/namespace as subjectNamespace,
 a/context/start_time/value as compositionStartTime,
 a/uid/value as compositionId,
 a/composer/name as composerName,
 a/composer/external_ref/id/value as composerId,
 a/composer/external_ref/namespace as composerNamespace,
 b_a/uid/value as entryId,
 b_a/protocol[at0042]/items[at0062]/value/value as AssertedDate,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0002]/value/value as Causative_agent_value,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0002]/value/defining_code/code_string as Causative_agent_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0002]/value/defining_code/terminology_id/value as Causative_agent_terminology,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0063]/value/defining_code/code_string as Status_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0101]/value/defining_code/code_string as Criticality_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0120]/value/defining_code/code_string as Category_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0117]/value/value as Onset_of_last_reaction,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0058]/value/defining_code/code_string as Reaction_mechanism_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0006]/value/value as Comment,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0010] as Specific_substance,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0021]/value/defining_code/code_string as Certainty_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0011]/value/value as Manifestation_value,    
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0011]/value/defining_code/code_string as Manifestation_code, 
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0011]/value/defining_code/terminology_id/value as Manifestation_terminology, 
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0012]/value/value as Reaction_description,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0027]/value/value as Onset_of_reaction,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0089]/value/defining_code/code_string as Severity_code,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0106] as Route_of_exposure,
 b_a/data[at0001]/items[at0009]/items[at0032]/value/value as Adverse_reaction_risk_Comment
 from EHR e
 contains COMPOSITION a[openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.adverse_reaction_list.v1]
 contains EVALUATION b_a[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.adverse_reaction_risk.v1]
 where a/name/value='Adverse reaction list'"
}

request.description:
Returns an OpenEhr template in its web-appropriate representation (as a JSON object).

A note on languages: the web template will be generated with localized names for all the languages that the underlying template supports, unless it is specified differently via the defaultLanguage and languages query parameters, both of which are optional. The defaultLanguage parameter determines the default name for each web template node (the localizedName property), whereas the languages parameter will generate additional localized names inside the localizedNames map for all the languages listed in this parameter (different languages should be separated by a comma: en,sl,no). See the example below.

Note that the underlying OpenEhr template needs to support these languages, or else a 400 error (bad request) will be returned (TMPL-3061).

        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.procedure.v1</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="comment">Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the procedure by name.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.</items>
          <items id="description">Structured information about the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure detail</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">The procedure to be undertaken is planned.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.</items>
          <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Complication</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0007">
          <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure request sent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.</items>
          <items id="text">Reason</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0034">
          <items id="comment">(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)</items>
          <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
          <items id="text">X - Procedure planned</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="comment">(Was: Request for procedure sent.)</items>
          <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
          <items id="text">X - Procedure request sent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0036">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been scheduled.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been postponed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure postponed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0039">
          <items id="description">The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure cancelled</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been suspended.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0041">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been aborted.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0043">
          <items id="description">The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure completed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0047">
          <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure performed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0048">
          <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Outcome of procedure performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Outcome</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0049">
          <items id="comment">For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="description">Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
          <items id="text">Description</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0053">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0054">
          <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
          <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0055">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
          <items id="text">Requestor</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0056">
          <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
          <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
          <items id="text">Receiver</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0058">
          <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
          <items id="description">Urgency of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Urgency</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0060">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.</items>
          <items id="description">The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.</items>
          <items id="text">Final end date/time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0061">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.</items>
          <items id="description">The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.</items>
          <items id="text">Total duration</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="comment">Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of the body site for the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Body site</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0064">
          <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
          <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
          <items id="description">Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Method</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0066">
          <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.</items>
          <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.</items>
          <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0067">
          <items id="comment">This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.</items>
          <items id="description">The type of procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure type</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0068">
          <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedure commenced</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0069">
          <items id="comment">Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.</items>
          <items id="description">Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.</items>
          <items id="text">Procedural difficulty</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>

          <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0008">
          <items id="comment">UI Guidance: Display '1. In general, would you say your health is:'.</items>
          <items id="description">Patient reported rating of general health.</items>
          <items id="text">1. Health in general</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0009">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general as being excellent.</items>
          <items id="text">Excellent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general as being very good.</items>
          <items id="text">Very good</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0011">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general as being good.</items>
          <items id="text">Good</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0012">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general as being fair.</items>
          <items id="text">Fair</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0013">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general as being poor.</items>
          <items id="text">Poor</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="comment">UI Guidance: Display '2. Compared to one year ago, how would your rate your health in general now?'</items>
          <items id="description">Patient reported rating of health in general now compared to one year ago.</items>
          <items id="text">2. Health compared to 1 year ago</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0015">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general now as being much better than one year ago.</items>
          <items id="text">Much better</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0016">
          <items id="description">Patient reports health in general now as being somewhat better than one year ago.</items>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201  Success.

400  Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401  Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403  Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter  Value  Description  Parameter Type  Data Type
templateId
required
  The ID of the template to load.  path  string
defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages
optional
  Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.  query  string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.  query  enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example

required

defaultLanguage
optional
  The default language to generate the web template with.  query  string
languages

format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.  query  enum

(GUIDE) <
  gdl_version = <"0.1">
  id = <"das28_test">
  concept = <"gt0001">
  language = (LANGUAGE) <
    original_language = <[ISO_639-1::en]>
  >
  description = (RESOURCE_DESCRIPTION) <
    details = <
      ["en"] = (RESOURCE_DESCRIPTION_ITEM) <
        copyright = <"">
        keywords = <"DAS28", "Rheumatoid Arthritis">
        misuse = <"Not for use outside of DAS28 or licensing terms.">
        purpose = <"A GDL tool to assess Rheumatoid Arthritis disease activity.">
        use = <"For use as part of rheumatology assessments.">
      >
    >
    original_author = <
      ["date"] = <"10/11/2016">
      ["email"] = <"mark@operon.systems">
      ["name"] = <"Mark Greenhalgh">
      ["organisation"] = <"Operon Ltd, UK">
    >
    other_contributors = <"Mark Greenhalgh", "Nadim Anani">
    other_details = <
      ["references"] = <"http://www.das-score.nl/das28/en/introduction-menu.html">
    >
  >
  definition = (GUIDE_DEFINITION) <
    archetype_bindings = <
      ["gt0003"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
        archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.das28.v0">
        domain = <"EHR">
        elements = <
          ["gt0004"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0004]">
          >
          ["gt0005"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0005]">
          >
          ["gt0006"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0006]">
          >
          ["gt0007"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <

          >
        >
      >
      ["gt0008"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
        archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.das28.v0">
        domain = <"CDS">
        elements = <
          ["gt0009"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0008]">
          >
        >
      >
      ["gt0010"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
        archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
        domain = <"CDS">
        elements = <
          ["gt0011"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
          >
        >
      >
      ["gt0012"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
        archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
        domain = <"CDS">
        elements = <
          ["gt0013"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
          >
        >
      >
      ["gt0014"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
        archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
        domain = <"CDS">
        elements = <
          ["gt0015"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
            path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
          >
        >
      >
    >
    rules = <
      ["gt0002"] = (RULE) <
        when = <"$gt0007!=null", "$gt0006!=null", "$gt0005!=null", "$gt0004!=null">
        then = <"$gt0009.precision=2", "$gt0009.magnitude=($gt0004.magnitude + $gt0005.magnitude)">
        priority = <1>
      >
    >
  >
  ontology = (GUIDE_ONTOLOGY) <
    term_definitions = <
      ["en"] = (TERM_DEFINITION) <
        terms = <
          ["gt0001"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"DAS28 Test">
            description = <"Calculates DAS28 score from observation data.">
          >
          ["gt0002"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"DAS28 Calculation">
          >
          ["gt0004"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Tender joints">
            description = <"Count of tender joints.">
          >
          ["gt0005"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Swollen joints">
            description = <"Count of swollen joints.">
          >
          ["gt0006"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"ESR">
            description = <"Erythrocyte sedimentation rate.">
          >
          ["gt0007"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Patient global health">
            description = <"Patient global health visual analogue scale.">
          >
          ["gt0009"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Total score">
            description = <"Total DAS 28 score.">
          >
          ["gt0011"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Total score">
            description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
          >
          ["gt0013"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Total score">
            description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
          >
          ["gt0015"] = (TERM) <
            text = <"Total score">
            description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
          >
        >
      >
    >
  >
>

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                          <items id="description">Laboratoriesvar som en enkeltverdi eller i grupper/pakker som er vanlig i kliniske prøveanalyser.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratoriesvargruppe</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                          <items id="description">Faktisk verdi av prøvesvaret. Navnet på dette dataelementet er vanligvis erstattet i templat eller i applikasjon, slik at det samsvarer med den faktiske analysen. For eksempel "S-Na" eller "Serum Natrium". Det vil også som regel være kodet ved hjelp av et kodeverk.</items>
                          <items id="text">Svarverdi</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                          <items id="description">Spesifikt detaljert svar, som inkluderer både verdien og tilleggsinformasjon som kan være nyttig for klinisk tolkning.</items>
                          <items id="text">Analysesvar</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                          <items id="description">Kommentar til svaret.</items>
                          <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                          <items id="description">Tilleggsinformasjon med råd for referanseområdets hensiktsmessighet.</items>
                          <items id="text">Veiledning til referanseområdet</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                          <items id="description">Svarverdiens status</items>
                          <items id="text">Svarstatus</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                          <items id="description">Dato og/eller tidspunkt hele svaret ble utstedt for den registrerte Svarstatus.</items>
                          <items id="text">Tidspunkt for svarstatus</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                          <items id="description">Ikke tilgjengelig svar ennå.</items>
                          <items id="text">Registrert</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                          <items id="description">Dette er et midlertidig eller foreløpig svar. Data kan mangle, eller være uverifisert.</items>
                          <items id="text">Foreløpig</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
                          <items id="text">Endelig</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er endret etter å ha hatt status Endelig, og er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
                          <items id="text">Endret</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er ikke tilgjengelig fordi analysen ikke ble påbegynt eller ferdigstilt.</items>
                          <items id="text">Kansellert</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er ikke tilgjengelig siden analysen ikke ble bestilt.</items>
                          <items id="text">Ikke bestilt</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                          <items id="description">Ytterligere detaljer, inkludert informasjon om prøveeksemplaret i analysepakker, eller når materialet deles opp i flere forskjellige analyser.</items>
                          <items id="text">Andre detaljer</items>
                        </term_definitions>

        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test.v0</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="comment">Denne arketypen kan brukes for å registrere en enkeltverdi av en analyse, men vil ofte bli spesialisert eller lagt inn i en templat for å representere flere verdier eller pakker av analyser. Denne arketypen fungerer også som forelder for spesialiserte laboratoresvar-arketyper, for eksempel mikrobiologi eller patologi.</items>
          <items id="description">Funn og tolkning av laboratorieanalyse utført på prøvemateriale fra pasient.</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratoriesvar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Event Series(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">Standard, uspesifisert tidspunkt eller tidsintervall som kan defineres mer eksplisitt i en templat eller i en applikasjon.</items>
          <items id="text">Uspesifisert hendelse</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="comment">Et prøveresultat kan gjelde for en enkelt analyse eller en gruppe av analyser, inkludert analysepakker. Koding med en terminologi, eventuelt med en prekoordinert term inkludert prøvetype er å foretrekke, hvis mulig. Kan bli kodet med LOINC eller SNOMED CT eller nasjonale laboratoriekodeverk. Eksempler kan være "Glukose", "Urea og elektrolytter", "Dyrkning", "Kortisol (morgen)" eller "Leverbiopsi".</items>
          <items id="description">Identifikasjon av den utførte analysen, av og til inkludert prøvetype og pasientens tilstand</items>
          <items id="text">Analysenavn</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="comment">Flere formater tillates, men disse må være semantisk sammenlignbare.</items>
          <items id="description">Representasjon av hele svaret, slik det er utstedt av utførende laboratorium i rik tekst eller som multimedia.</items>
          <items id="text">Svarrepresentasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">Demografiske detaljer til laboratoriet som er ansvarlig for analysen.</items>
          <items id="text">Ansvarlig laboratorium</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="description">Detaljert informasjon om kliniker eller organisatorisk enhet som skal motta en kopi av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Distribusjonsliste</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0037">
          <items id="description">Dette er et delvis (dvs initalt, foreløpig eller preliminært) svar: Data i svaret kan være ukomplett eller ubekreftet.</items>
          <items id="text">Delvis</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">Svaret er komplett og er bekreftet av ansvarlig person.</items>
          <items id="text">Endelig</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">Svaret har blitt endret etter at det var meldt Endelig, og er komplett og verifisert av den ansvarlige laboratorielege, og svardata har blitt endret.</items>
          <items id="text">Revidert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">Konsis, tekstlig tolkning av laboratoriesvaret, satt i en klinisk sammenheng.</items>
          <items id="text">Konklusjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="comment">Tilsvarende HL7 "Placer Order Identifier".</items>
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er tildelt rekvisisjonen av den som har rekvirert.</items>
          <items id="text">RekvisisjonsID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="comment">En ID tilordnet rekvisisjonen av laboratorieinformasjonssystemet (LIS) åpner for sporing av fremdrift og til å koble svar til rekvisisjoner. Det gir også en referanse for forespørsler, og tilsvarer som regel HL7 "Filler Order Identifier".</items>
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er tildelt rekvisisjonen av utførende laboratorie, vanligvis av laboratoriesystemet (LIS).</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratoriets rekvisisjonsID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om prøven dersom alle prøveresultater er avledet fra samme prøvemateriale. Hvis prøvematerialet er tilstrekkelig spesifisert med en kode i Prøvenavn, er dette dataelementet overflødig. Hvis det er multiple prøver, kan disse representeres per "resultatgruppe".</items>
          <items id="text">Prøvedetaljer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0068">
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er gitt til analysesvaret av laboratoriesystemet (LIS).</items>
          <items id="text">SvarID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0073">
          <items id="description">Overordnet status på analyseresultatet.</items>
          <items id="text">Analysestatus</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0074">
          <items id="description">Svaret er utilgjengelig fordi analysen ikke ble påbegynt eller ferdigstilt (også kalt "avbrutt").</items>
          <items id="text">Kansellert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0075">
          <items id="description">Dato og/eller tidspunkt hele svaret var utstedt for svarrapporten.</items>
          <items id="text">Dato/tid svarrapport</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0077">
          <items id="comment">For eksempel klinisk biokjemi, mikrobiologi, hematologi, patologi. Dette hjelper klinikere med å filtrere mellom svarkategorier i henhold til lokal organisering av laboratorier. Koding med en terminologi er ønskelig, der det er mulig.</items>
          <items id="description">Laboratoriefaglig service som utfører analysen</items>
          <items id="text">Kategori laboratoriefag</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0090">
          <items id="description">Detaljer knyttet til kliniker eller organisatorisk enhet som revkvirerer analysen.</items>
          <items id="text">Rekvirent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0094">
          <items id="comment">Det finnes som regel en rekvisisjon for hvert svar, men i noen omstendigheter kan flere rekvisisjoner representeres ved hjelp av en enkelt laboratoriesvar-arketype.</items>
          <items id="description">Detaljer knyttet til en rekvirert enkeltanalyse.</items>
          <items id="text">Rekvisisjonsdetaljer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0097">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om analysesvar, muligens en individuell analyse, en gruppe, en pakke eller samling av mange svar, eller en mer kompleks og spesifikk struktur.</items>
          <items id="text">Analysesvar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0098">
          <items id="comment">Koding med en terminologi foretrekkes, der det er mulig.</items>
          <items id="description">Enkeltord, frase eller kort beskrivelse som beskriver teksten i "Konklusjon".</items>
          <items id="text">Diagnose</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0100">
          <items id="comment">I HL7 FHIR lagres denne informasjonen innen lenket requestDetail.clinical.</items>
          <items id="description">Beskrivelse av klinisk informasjon som er tilgjengelig på tolkningstidspunktet, noe som kan inkludere en lenke til den originale kliniske informasjonen som ble gitt i rekvisisjonen.</items>
          <items id="text">Tilgjengelig klinisk informasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0101">
          <items id="description">Tekstlig tilleggsinformasjon som ikke er registrert i andre felt.</items>
          <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0106">
          <items id="description">Identifikasjon av den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen, dersom det er forskjell mellom det som er rekvirert og det som faktisk er utført.</items>
          <items id="text">Navn på opprinnelig rekvirert analyse</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0107">
          <items id="description">Analysen er registrert i laboratoriesystemet (LIS), men svaret er ikke tilgjengelig per nå.</items>
          <items id="text">Registrert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0110">
          <items id="description">Strukturert tilleggsinformasjon om hvilken analysemetode som er fulgt. For eksempel, strukturerte detaljer om hviken metode laboratoriet har brukt og tolket dataene.</items>
          <items id="text">Detaljer om analysemetode/utstyr</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0111">
          <items id="description">Sann hvis resultatet er basert på analyse med pasientnært utstyr i stedet for en mer formell laboratorietjeneste.</items>
          <items id="text">Pasientnært analyseutstyr</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0112">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0113">
          <items id="description">Forhold i tilstanden eller omstendlighetene til en pasient som kan endre tolkningen av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Konfunderende faktorer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0114">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om pasientens tilstand som kan endre tolkning av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Detaljer om pasienttilstand</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0115">
          <items id="description">Svaret har blitt modifisert etter å ha vært i status Ferdig, og er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
          <items id="text">Korrigert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0116">
          <items id="description">Analysesvaret har blitt trukket tilbake etter å ha vært i status Endelig.</items>
          <items id="text">Feilregistrert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0117">
          <items id="description">Ytterligere informasjon som er nødvendig for å registrere lokalt innhold/kontekst, eller for å sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.</items>
          <items id="text">Tilleggsinformasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="NPU19719">
          <items id="text">P-CEA</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.report.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IAN - Kreftregisteret Kolorektalskjema utredning</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">Dokument som brukes for å kommunisere informasjon til andre, ofte som svar på en forespørsel.</items>
      <items id="text">Rapport</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0001">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="description">Rapportidentifikator.</items>
      <items id="text">Rapport ID</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0005">
      <items id="description">Status for hele rapporten. NB: Dette er ikke status for enkeltkomponentene i rapporten.</items>
      <items id="text">Status</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0006">
      <items id="comment">F.eks. lokale informasjonskrav eller ekstra metadata for å samsvare med FHIR eller CIMI ekvivalenter.</items>
      <items id="description">Ytterligere informasjon som er nødvendig for å sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.</items>
      <items id="text">Tilleggsinformasjon</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>

request.description: Retrieve a list of available form definitions

item.name: Retrieve a form by name and version

request.description:
Returns a Think!EHR form denoted by its name and version.

This call can return only the form and form resource meta-data (the default), or it can already expand the specified (or all) form resources. See the description of the resources parameter for details.

In the case of resource expansion, for the resources that are of the source type (text, JSON etc.), this method will do its best to transform the resource content into the correct JSON type (for example, a JSON object, or a JSON text node). For binary resources, the content resource property will contain raw bytes.

response.name: Retrieve a form by name and version

header.name: Content-Language
header.description: The language the content is in

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.
